intro: Elaphoglossum macrorhizum, commonly known as the large-rooted holly fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds that are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, with a feathery appearance. The plant prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions, particularly in forest understories. Its rhizomes are notably thick and fleshy, contributing to its common name. Elaphoglossum macrorhizum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
